body: I'm wondering if this issue hasn't been resolved by PR: [Add line numbers to st.code #6042](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/6042). What do you think?
@sfc-gh-kbregula: I guess this has not yet been released on pypi.org ... how can I replace the pip-installable dependency with the latest github source?

Hey @ya55en, the https://pypi.org/project/streamlit-nightly/ PyPI project can be used to test out changes merged to `develop` before they appear in official releases (the binary after running `pip install streamlit-nightly` is still just `streamlit`).

I'm not sure if this has been fixed, but I'd also really appreciate if both st.code and st.markdown didn't strip any whitespaces (or maybe if there was a keyword to toggle this behaviour)!
Thank you!

issue.title: `st.code(body)` will trim `body`

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit â€” A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [X] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [X] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

`st.code(body)` will trim `body`, which is not expected.

If this is feature, it shall be documented in `st.code()`.

### Reproducible Code Example

```Python
import streamlit as st

st.title("Demo")

if 'banner' not in st.session_state:
    st.session_state.banner = '   def hello():'

if st.session_state.banner != '':
    with st.expander("Banner"):
        st.code('\n' + st.session_state.banner, language=None, line_numbers=True)
```


### Steps To Reproduce

1. Run the code;
2. Check the generated web page: content in `banner` is trimmed.

![image](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/assets/4046440/61fa925c-e5bf-4461-860f-69acf72982c2)


### Expected Behavior

`body` should not be trimmed automatically. 

### Current Behavior

`body` is be trimmed automatically. 

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version:  1.32.2
- Python version: 3.10.13
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Browser: Edge


### Additional Information

_No response_

body: I can confirm this problem still exists, even if the unprocessed raw text is used in `markdown_proto.body`.

issue.title: [fix] Preserve leading whitespaces in markdown codeblock

repository.name: streamlit

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

Do not trim content for `st.markdown` and `st.code`.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

Fixes #6302

- #6302

## Testing Plan

- E2E Tests

body: I opened a PR #10065 to fix this. ```python import streamlit as st block = """\ line 1 line 2 line 3 """.rstrip() st.code(block) st.markdown(f"```\n{block}\n```") ```

**If this issue affects you, please react with a ðŸ‘ (thumbs up emoji) to the initial post.**

Your feedback helps us prioritize which bugs to investigate and address first.

![Views](https://api.views-badge.org/badge/st-issue-6302)
